main event: Multiple airmen reported sighting a round orange-colored object that appeared to hover, oscillate, and exhibit high-speed movement before disappearing into the clouds over Ramore, Ontario, on 25 May 1953.
interesting points: The object was initially observed about 5 miles away and appeared to be stationary before it began moving and eventually disappeared into the clouds.
The object was described to be around 30 to 40 feet in diameter, making oscillating or wobbling movements as it approached the observers.
Despite its size, the object was capable of moving at terrific speeds and making abrupt changes in direction, leaving a small indication where it broke through the clouds.
The sighting involved multiple credible witnesses, including Dean McDonald, Vittoria Battini, Paul Ryan, Thomas McLaughlin, Thomas Griffin, and more, all of whom reported the same object.

Although no physical evidence or photographs were obtained, the sighting was deemed unexplained, with no interception or identification action taken and no air traffic in the general area at the time.
sighted object: round orange-colored object exhibiting high-speed movements and disappearing into the clouds
witnesses: multiple credible witnesses including USAF airmen
photographs: no the report does not include photographs
